page.title: 10FARMING - CROPS
page.content: Farming in this area is largely arable with crops of wheat, barley and oil- seed rape. Often a small acreage of potatoes is grown. Fodder crops include lucerne and grass, for hay and silage, for feeding stock in adjacent areas. Sheep are the principle grazing animals. Apple orchards produce fruit for market and for juice extraction. Soft fruits are grown, especially for the Pick-your-own trade. There is a self-pick farm at Pett Bottom and the popularity of direct selling has also encouraged the growing of a wide range of vegetables. These trends have been important to the small farmer, who has found it necessary to diversify in order to survive. Those with 100 acres or less cannot be commercially viable without augmenting their income; one farmer operates a school mini-bus, whilst another offers Bed & Breakfast.
